SEARCH
Package org.lwjgl.openxr

Class HTCFacialTracking

java.lang.Object
org.lwjgl.openxr.HTCFacialTracking
public class HTCFacialTracking extends Object
The XR_HTC_facial_tracking extension.

This extension allows an application to track and integrate users' eye and lip movements, empowering developers to read intention and model facial expressions.

    • XR_FACIAL_TRACKING_TYPE_EYE_DEFAULT_HTC

      public static final int XR_FACIAL_TRACKING_TYPE_EYE_DEFAULT_HTC
      XrFacialTrackingTypeHTC - Describes the type of facial tracking.
      Enumerant Descriptions
      • FACIAL_TRACKING_TYPE_EYE_DEFAULT_HTCSpecifies this handle will observe eye expressions, with values indexed by XrEyeExpressionHTC whose count is FACIAL_EXPRESSION_EYE_COUNT_HTC.
      • FACIAL_TRACKING_TYPE_LIP_DEFAULT_HTCSpecifies this handle will observe lip expressions, with values indexed by XrLipExpressionHTC whose count is FACIAL_EXPRESSION_LIP_COUNT_HTC.
      See Also

      XrFacialTrackerCreateInfoHTC

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • nxrCreateFacialTrackerHTC

      public static int nxrCreateFacialTrackerHTC(XrSession session, long createInfo, long facialTracker)
      Unsafe version of: CreateFacialTrackerHTC

    • xrCreateFacialTrackerHTC

      public static int xrCreateFacialTrackerHTC(XrSession session, XrFacialTrackerCreateInfoHTC createInfo, PointerBuffer facialTracker)
      Create an facial tracker handle.
      C Specification

      The CreateFacialTrackerHTC function is defined as

      
 XrResult xrCreateFacialTrackerHTC(
     XrSession                                   session,
     const XrFacialTrackerCreateInfoHTC*         createInfo,
     XrFacialTrackerHTC*                         facialTracker);
      Description

      An application can create an XrFacialTrackerHTC handle using CreateFacialTrackerHTC.

      If the system does not support eye tracking or lip tracking, runtime must return ERROR_FEATURE_UNSUPPORTED from CreateFacialTrackerHTC according to the corresponding case. In this case, the runtime must return FALSE for supportEyeFacialTracking or supportLipFacialTracking in XrSystemFacialTrackingPropertiesHTC when the function GetSystemProperties is called, so that the application may avoid creating a facial tracker.

      Valid Usage (Implicit)
      • The XR_HTC_facial_tracking extension must be enabled prior to calling CreateFacialTrackerHTC
      • session must be a valid XrSession handle
      • createInfo must be a pointer to a valid XrFacialTrackerCreateInfoHTC structure
      • facialTracker must be a pointer to an XrFacialTrackerHTC handle
      Return Codes
      On success, this command returns
      • SUCCESS
      • SESSION_LOSS_PENDING
      On failure, this command returns
      • ERROR_FUNCTION_UNSUPPORTED
      • ERROR_VALIDATION_FAILURE
      • ERROR_RUNTIME_FAILURE
      • ERROR_HANDLE_INVALID
      • ERROR_INSTANCE_LOST
      • ERROR_SESSION_LOST
      • ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY
      • ERROR_LIMIT_REACHED
      • ERROR_FEATURE_UNSUPPORTED
      See Also

      XrFacialTrackerCreateInfoHTC, DestroyFacialTrackerHTC

      Parameters:
      session - an XrSession in which the facial expression will be active.
      createInfo - the XrFacialTrackerCreateInfoHTC used to specify the facial tracking type.
      facialTracker - the returned XrFacialTrackerHTC handle.

    • xrDestroyFacialTrackerHTC

      public static int xrDestroyFacialTrackerHTC(XrFacialTrackerHTC facialTracker)
      Destroy a facial tracker handle.
      C Specification

      The DestroyFacialTrackerHTC function is defined as:

      
 XrResult xrDestroyFacialTrackerHTC(
     XrFacialTrackerHTC                          facialTracker);
      Description

      DestroyFacialTrackerHTC releases the facialTracker and the underlying resources when finished with facial tracking experiences.

      Valid Usage (Implicit)
      • The XR_HTC_facial_tracking extension must be enabled prior to calling DestroyFacialTrackerHTC
      • facialTracker must be a valid XrFacialTrackerHTC handle
      Thread Safety
      • Access to facialTracker, and any child handles, must be externally synchronized
      Return Codes
      On success, this command returns
      • SUCCESS
      On failure, this command returns
      • ERROR_FUNCTION_UNSUPPORTED
      • ERROR_HANDLE_INVALID
      Parameters:
      facialTracker - an XrFacialTrackerHTC previously created by CreateFacialTrackerHTC.

    • nxrGetFacialExpressionsHTC

      public static int nxrGetFacialExpressionsHTC(XrFacialTrackerHTC facialTracker, long facialExpressions)
      Unsafe version of: GetFacialExpressionsHTC

    • xrGetFacialExpressionsHTC

      public static int xrGetFacialExpressionsHTC(XrFacialTrackerHTC facialTracker, XrFacialExpressionsHTC facialExpressions)
      Retrieve facial expressions.
      C Specification

      The GetFacialExpressionsHTC function is defined as:

      
 XrResult xrGetFacialExpressionsHTC(
     XrFacialTrackerHTC                          facialTracker,
     XrFacialExpressionsHTC*                     facialExpressions);
      Description

      GetFacialExpressionsHTC retrieves an array of values of blend shapes for a facial expression on a given time.

      Valid Usage (Implicit)
      • The XR_HTC_facial_tracking extension must be enabled prior to calling GetFacialExpressionsHTC
      • facialTracker must be a valid XrFacialTrackerHTC handle
      • facialExpressions must be a pointer to an XrFacialExpressionsHTC structure
      Return Codes
      On success, this command returns
      • SUCCESS
      On failure, this command returns
      • ERROR_FUNCTION_UNSUPPORTED
      • ERROR_VALIDATION_FAILURE
      • ERROR_RUNTIME_FAILURE
      • ERROR_HANDLE_INVALID
      • ERROR_INSTANCE_LOST
      • ERROR_TIME_INVALID
      See Also

      XrFacialExpressionsHTC

      Parameters:
      facialTracker - an XrFacialTrackerHTC previously created by CreateFacialTrackerHTC.
      facialExpressions - a pointer to XrFacialExpressionsHTC receiving the returned facial expressions.
